etymologies: early 16th century (in the general senses ‘short written note’ and ‘a license or permit’): shortening of obsolete French étiquet, from Old French estiquet(te), from estiquier ‘to fix’, from Middle Dutch steken. Compare with etiquette

definitions: a piece of paper or small card that gives the holder a certain right, especially to enter a place, travel by public transport, or participate in an event
shortDefinitions: piece of paper or card that gives holder certain rightt

definitions: a piece of paper or card bought as a way of entering a lottery or raffle

examples.text: the winning ticket was bought in Anaheim, California

shortDefinitions: piece of paper bought to enter lottery or raffle

definitions: (in information technology) a request logged on a work tracking system detailing an issue that needs to be addressed or task that must be performed

examples.text: if you have opened a ticket and it's not yet been resolved, there's no need to open a new one
they closed the ticket without doing anything

shortDefinitions: request logged on work tracking system detailing issue that needs to be addressed

definitions: a method of getting into or out of (a specified state or situation)

examples.text: drugs are seen as the only ticket out of poverty
companies that appeared to have a one-way ticket to profitability

shortDefinitions: method of getting into or out of

definitions: an official notice of a traffic offense

examples.text: the officer issued Rhodes a speeding ticket

definitions: a certificate of qualification as a ship's master, pilot, or other crew member.
shortDefinitions: certificate of qualification as ship's master, pilot

definitions: a label attached to a retail product, giving its price, size, and other details.
shortDefinitions: label attached to retail product, giving its details

definitions: a list of candidates put forward by a party in an election

examples.text: his presence on the Republican ticket

shortDefinitions: list of candidates put forward by party in election

definitions: a set of principles or policies supported by a party in an election

examples.text: he stood for office on a strong right-wing, no-nonsense ticket

shortDefinitions: set of principles or policies supported by party in election

examples.text: a wet spring would be just the ticket for the garden

definitions: issue (someone) with an official notice of a traffic offense

examples.text: park illegally and you are likely to be ticketed

shortDefinitions: issue someone with official notice of traffic offence

definitions: (of a passenger) be issued with a travel ticket

examples.text: passengers can now get electronically ticketed

definitions: be destined or heading for a specified state or position

examples.text: they were sure that Downing was ticketed for greatness

shortDefinitions: be destined for specified state or position

definitions: (of a retail product) be marked with a label giving its price, size, and other details

examples.text: the sports jacket had been ticketed at two hundred dollars

shortDefinitions: (of retail product) be marked with label giving its details
